More than 60% of Americans disapprove of President Trump's national emergency declaration. It's time for Republicans to do the right thing and reject the #FakeTrumpEmergency https://www.npr.org/2019/02/19/695720851/poll-6-in-10-disapprove-of-trumps-declaration-of-a-national-emergency …
Hoping everyone enjoys their holiday. Happy President’s Day! pic.twitter.com/CK2dXftErM
This action sets a dangerous precedent and opens the door for future abuse of power. Building the wall is not a national emergency, and I strongly disagree with the President taking that action.

Make no mistake, the constitution gives Congress the power of the purse. The attempt by this President to circumvent Congress to pay for a campaign promise--that he said Mexico would pay for--is a gross overstep of the constitutional powers provided to the Executive Branch.

I'm pleased the President signed the bill, our federal government will remain open, and federal workers will continue to receive the pay they deserve. Unfortunately, the President cannot resist the urge to create chaos where none is needed.
The bipartisan funding bill that was passed by Congress last night was a good-faith effort by negotiators on both sides--precisely how our democracy is designed to function...
Trump's own admission that this is not a national emergency. You can't make this stuff up. https://twitter.com/davidmackau/status/1096442543330480134 …

Gun violence is a national emergency

Climate Change is a national emergency

Income inequality is a national emergency

Access to healthcare is a national emergency

Building a wall on the southern border is not.

President Trump is not King.

Congress is a co-EQUAL branch of government 

Friendly reminder that Congress does not need the President's signature to keep the government open. https://twitter.com/frankthorp/status/1096062586691506177 …

The bill would simplify the Plain Language Disclosure Form so that student borrowers better understand the terms of their student loans.

I'm hopeful that the @EdLaborCmte will consider my bill when examining potential changes to our higher education system.

The first step to empowerment is knowledge, and a basic step to tackling student loan debt is understanding what it means to take out a loan.

That's why I'm proud to reintroduce H.R. 1161, the Student Loan Disclosure Modernization Act with @repJimBanks! https://cleaver.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressmen-cleaver-and-banks-reintroduce-the-student-loan-disclosure …

In El Paso, between 1993 and 2006, violent crimes fell by more than 34%

For the 1,000,000th time:
 
Illegal immigration is NOT a security crisis. Illegal border crossings are down 80% since 2001. #SOTU

The president claims the #GOPTaxScam supercharged our economy.
 
In reality, it added $1.5 trillion to our debt, the vast majority of that money went to corporate stock buybacks, and 84% of business respondents have not changed plans to invest in their workforce. #SOTU

It’s great that unemployment is at 4%!
 
For reference, the unemployment rate peaked at 10% during the Great Recession and was cut in half to 4.7% by the time President Obama left office. #SOTU

President Trump claims to have revived the American economy.
 
Fun fact: The first 2 years of the Trump presidency actually created fewer jobs than the last 2 years of the Obama Presidency. #SOTU
